datafield.subfield: from the surveys conducted for the Committee of the Palestine Exploration Fund and other sources /
compiled by George Armstrong and revised by Colonel Sir Charles W. Wilson K.C.B., F.R.S., &c. and Major C.R. Conder D.C.L., R.E.
51 x 43 cm. or smaller, on 20 sheets 60 x 48 cm.

From cover: 'A map of Palestine from surveys conducted for the Committee of the Palestine Exploration Fund and other sources ... Engraved and printed for the Committee at Stanford's Geographical Establishment.'

Map of Palestine showing streams water courses, wells, aqueducts, mosques, watch towers, trig stations, roads and tracks with topographical and geographical terms in English and Arabic. Relief shown by hachures, shading and spot heights.
In lower margin of each sheet: P.E.F. Palestine.

Present are sheets 1-16, 20-23 (untitled). These sheets were intended to form one large map of at least 1000 x 880 cm., but since three sheets are missing we cannot supply exact dimensions. There is an earlier edition dated 1890, in 21 sheets, but the 1900 edition is extremely rare. The Albright library has two copies, both of which lack sheets 17-19. Copy 1 is bound, with 2 copies of sheet 13. Copy 2 is loose-leaf, with 2 copies of sheet 21; it is also missing sheets 6,9,10,15.

The sheets are untitled, but titles have been added in manuscript in copy 2. Sheets: 1. [title] -- 2. [Beirut]--3. [Damascus] -- 4. [Jebel el Kaus] -- 5. [copyright & scale information] -- 6. [Haifa] -- 7. [Kuneitra] -- 8. [Kenath Nobah] -- 9. [Jaffa] -- 10. [Nablus] -- 11. [Rabbath Ammon]-- 12. [Salekah] -- 13. [Gaza] -- 14. [Jerusalem] -- 15. [Bezer] -- 16. [Topographical & geographical terms] -- 20. [Kadesh Barnea] -- 21. [Bozrah] -- 22. [Kul'at el Garahy] -- 23. [Explanation, Key map].
Will require conservation work before use.
Digitized version of Copy 2, photography by Ardon Bar-Hama courtesy of George Blumenthal, available online on the AIAR website. See sheet links at:
Digitized version also available from the Albright CD collection (GA1321.B3).
